meanings.sent1: The wind advected the pollen from one flower to another.
meanings.sent2: The river advected the fallen leaves downstream.
meanings.sent3: The playful breeze advected the bubbles in all directions.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter advected joy throughout the room.
meanings.sent5: The conveyor belt advected the packages swiftly to their destination.

meanings.definition: To move or displace in a fluid or gas
meanings.sent1: The warm air advected the scent of freshly baked cookies into the room.
meanings.sent2: The ocean currents advected the nutrients to different parts of the sea.
meanings.sent3: The strong wind advected the kite high up into the sky.
meanings.sent4: His words advected a sense of calm amidst the chaos.
meanings.sent5: The heat from the stove advected the aroma of spices throughout the kitchen.
